text.__SUMMARY__: Conus polongimarumai is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 13 mm and 32 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs off the Philippines, the Marshall Islands; New Caledonia and Western Thailand.
text.References:
Kosuge S. (1980) Descriptions of two new species of the genus Conus (Gastropoda Conacea). Bulletin of the Institute of Malacology, Tokyo 1(4): 62-64, pl. 18.
Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
